image.altText: Group of people gathered outside

props.synopsis: Tasmania has elected another large crossbench, and Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter will need to listen to their priorities as they negotiate to form a minority government.

title.children: These crossbenchers will be key in deciding the next government of Tasmania

image.altText: A shower runs with water.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are facing a nearly 40 per cent hike in their water bills over four years in what is being dubbed a "major blow" to those already struggling with the cost of living.

title.children: Tasmanian water bills could rise by almost 40pc over four years

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: Former Miss Australia and Tasmanian MP Kathryn Hay is sentenced for emotional abuse and intimidation of her former husband Troy Richardson.

title.children: Suspended prison sentence for former Labor MP Kathryn Hay

image.altText: A man holding a piece of paper with hand-written calculations, totaling $24,520.

props.synopsis: TasWater has provided details on where the $1.7 billion in revenue — gained through proposed water bill hikes — would be spent. The utility argues its trying to break the cycle of underinvestment.

title.children: What benefits will Tasmanians see from a controversial hike in water bills?

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals say Labor should concede the Tasmanian election, as both parties continue discussions with crossbenchers.

title.children: Liberals call on Labor to concede Tasmanian election but Winter fights back

image.altText: Louise Elliot looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Hobart City councillor Louise Elliot wants to move Acknowledgement of Country and Welcome to Country protocols from official proceedings, arguing they are akin to religious rituals and being forced on people "against their will".

title.children: 'Fed up': Hobart councillor's push to move Acknowledgement of Country

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: While the wheeling and dealing continues over who will form government after the Tasmanian election, Airlie Ward and reporter Fiona Blackwood check out what the prospective governments are offering for health.

title.children: TassieCast: Can whoever forms government heal our health woes?

image.altText: Turtle (Joni) on her back with her head being supported by a volunteer..

props.synopsis: CT scans, shell scrub-downs and custom moon boots — these are all in a day's work at the Magnetic Island sea turtle clinic. We followed the journey of two of the clinic's patients, and the people who care for them.

title.children: Inside the island clinic where turtles are nursed back to health

image.altText: a dark clouds covers the skyline of birdsville in queensland

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: A young woman hooked up to a machine in a hospital.

props.synopsis: Cancer diagnosis in young people is on the rise, but there are practical ways to support loved ones going through treatment.

title.children: $500 just on parking: The practical realities of a cancer diagnosis

image.altText: An LNG flare flames out from a stack.

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice was unequivocal about the consequences for countries that make the climate crisis worse. As one of the world's biggest fossil fuel exporters, it puts Australia on notice.

title.children: World Court lights match under Australia's fossil fuel export industry

image.altText: A mean wearing a life vest sits on a rock with his head in his hands.

props.synopsis: Trying to get to the UK is a treacherous journey for refugees. Even if they make it, growing protests and increasingly hard-line policies are waiting for them.

title.children: Britain encouraged to look to Australia's 'tough' border policies

image.altText: Four actresses dressed as their characters pose for the camera against a black backdrop.

props.synopsis: You have to assume that the writers cherish these characters as much as their legions of fans do — and yet they twist them into strange and ludicrous shapes.

title.children: Who are these women and what have you done to Sex and the City?

image.altText: British and Irish Lions supporters dressed as lions with face paint

props.synopsis: The Wallabies must win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Saturday night to keep the Test series against the British and Irish Lions alive. Here is what you need to know about the second Test.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, what time is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: parents holding a new born baby in a black and white photo

props.synopsis: Milli Evrard died in the arms of her parents six days after birth. Test results delivered months later revealed she had a rare condition which scans had failed to pick up.

title.children: Born with broken arms and legs, Milli died six days after birth

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie and hat walking outside court surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: The conviction of former Liberal MP Gareth Ward on serious sexual offences should be curtains on his political career, but it might not be that simple.

title.children: A sitting MP has been found guilty of serious sex crimes. What happens next?

image.altText: A head shot of an older white woman with short light brown hair, wearing a red shirt, smiling warmly.

props.synopsis: Veteran broadcaster Geraldine Doogue AO looks at the longevity of the media industry and asks what next?

title.children: Geraldine Doogue on why the future of media doesn't have to be grim

image.altText: hulk hogan flexes while wearing red tights and a yellow tanktop

props.synopsis: Hulk Hogan's life of signature wrestling moves gave way to racist rants, lawsuits bankrolled by venture capitalists and shirt-tearing displays on the Republican campaign stage.

title.children: Hulk Hogan's path from wrestling icon to right-wing mouthpiece

image.altText: Man with red scarring on his face and wearing black shirt hugs taller man in black and white shirt, ambulance behind them.

props.synopsis: Three years after he suffered near-fatal burns, Andrew Gibson says he is ready to take back his life by travelling Australia but first wanted to thank his rescuers.

title.children: When Andrew was set alight, a passer-by and paramedic saved his life

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: A top US Justice Department official spends hours interviewing Ghislaine Maxwell, the imprisoned accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as President Donald Trump struggles to tamp down a furore over his handling of the explosive case.

title.children: Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell speaks with US Justice Department

image.altText: Toby Greene and Tom Papley clash

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs soar back into the top eight with a demolition job on Bombers, while the Giants complete an incredible comeback win over the Swans in the Sydney Derby.

title.children: Kingsley addresses Greene 'overweight' taunt, as key Bomber hurt again

image.altText: Katarzyna Niewiadoma holds up her bike

props.synopsis: The Tour de France Femmes produced one of the closest finishes in cycling stage race history last year. But when the women's Tour was first revived, it was called "ugly".

title.children: 'A woman on a bicycle, it's ugly': The astonishing story behind the women's Tour

image.altText: A screenshot of Reece Walsh's near match-winner for the Brisbane Broncos against the Parramatta Eels.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Moses's return sparks the Eels to a 22-20 win over the fifth-placed Broncos as Reece Walsh has a last-minute match-winner taken off him by the bunker.

title.children: Reece Walsh calls BS as bunker denies his last-minute match-winner

image.altText: Two rocket launchers fire, sending large plumes of fire and smoke into densely-covered bushland

props.synopsis: Bangkok says it will consider the proposal put forward by Malaysia, but says any deal must be based on "appropriate on-the-ground conditions".

title.children: Thailand agrees in principle to Cambodia ceasefire, thousands evacuate

image.altText: A graphic image of batteries on houses.

props.synopsis: For the first time, battery sales in Australia have surpassed sales of solar panels. Now retail giant Bunnings wants a piece of the action.

title.children: Bunnings makes a play in 'hyper-competitive' solar, battery market

image.altText: A middle-aged man with white hair wearing a suit with a yellow tie.

props.synopsis: When Clive Palmer's political parties were attacked by cybercriminals, it also affected his coal, nickel, and resort endeavours.

title.children: Banking, employment data stolen from Clive Palmer's companies

image.altText: A colourful photographic installation with one image of a man and one of a woman in the centre, with collages on either side.

props.synopsis: The minds behind iconic fashion house Romance Was Born, Anna Plunkett and Luke Sales, are the focus of a new photographic installation at the National Portrait Gallery in Canberra.

title.children: 'Opulent, unique' photographic installation reflects iconic fashion brand

image.altText: Joe Root, in England white cricket gear, raises his bat and helmet in the air.

props.synopsis: England's Joe Root overtakes Ricky Ponting as the second-greatest scorer in Test cricket history.

title.children: 'A moment in history': Ponting pays tribute to Root as records tumble

image.altText: A dark black trailer has the logo of White Hills fnc on it. In the background is their football oval

props.synopsis: The AFL says it wants to "protect" the White Hills Junior Football Club following revelations it allowed a convicted sex offender parent to time-keep at his son's match.

title.children: Club allowed convicted sex offender to time-keep at junior football match

image.altText: Julie-Ann Campbell with her mother and daughter.

props.synopsis: A record number of Chinese Australian politicians now sit in federal parliament. They reflect on challenges they have faced and why diversity in Australia's parliament is important.

title.children: Chinese Australian politicians on why they joined parliament

image.altText: Two people stand in front of a stage, and wear rainbow-coloured clothing.

props.synopsis: A diversity and inclusion festival held annually on the NSW Central Coast is in doubt because of a clash with a major sporting event in another city.

title.children: Council rejects LGBTQIA+ event due to NRL grand final clash 80km away

image.altText: Two men look for samples in a river

props.synopsis: Floods recorded in Aboriginal oral history centuries ago could help scientists better understand how climate change may affect flood risk in the future.

title.children: The huge event that could rewrite the history of this 'dangerous flood plain'

image.altText: Rescue workers evacuate flood-affected residents

props.synopsis: Storms in northern China have poured nearly a year's rainfall on Baoding, an industrial city on the doorstep of capital Beijing, forcing over 19,000 people out of their homes.

title.children: Storms dump nearly a year of rain in northern China, Beijing braces for floods

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: A woman in white sneakers walking up stairs.

props.synopsis: While many people aim for 10,000 steps a day, new research finds 7,000 daily steps can provide meaningful health improvements and may be a more "realistic" goal.

title.children: Just 7,000 steps a day linked to big health gains, research finds
